moves.1. e4:
Hi everyone!

This is my third game in Master Freddy's mini-tournament about the Sicilian Grand Prix Attack.  For me it was third time lucky in respect of clocking up my first win (although the Low Draw with Yoshark - which he annotated, I was extremely lucky!).  In response to 9. Bxg4 I try a different response, g6 to see what happened there and it certainly worked out well.  Anyhow, on with the match.  We pick up the action on move 9.
moves.1... c5 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: 9. ....... g6 - prepares a bishop fianchetto to g7.
moves.10. Nf7: 10. Nf7 - a nasty looking knight fork but Glenda is now gonna take you all by surprise, she decides to venture into enemy territory.
moves.10... Qd4: 10. ....... Qd4 - an aggressive placement for a Queen do you agree, she could be chased away but white decides to develop.
moves.11. Nc3 Bg7 12. Nxh8 Bxh8: 12. .......... Bxh8 - that's gotten rid of that nasty horsie even at the expense of one of my castles!
moves.13. Ne2 Qf6: 13. ....... Qf6 - Glenda is now chased away but she finds a fairly decent square.
moves.15. g3 Nb4: 15. ........ Nb4 - now my horsie gets in on the act - he is threatening Nc2+
moves.17. c3 Nd3: 17. ....... Nd3 - what's this? What's this?  Aggressive stuff from Joanne the Kitten?  Yup, it is certainly that, for a starters the WK is pinned in the centre.
moves.18. Rf1 Qd6: 18. ....... Qd6 - now Glenda lines up on the d file.
moves.19. Kc2 Nxc1 20. Raxc1: 20. Raxc1 - a N for B trade.  Now the d3 square is occupied by .........
moves.21. Kb3 c4+: 21. ...... c4+ - a king hunt begins in earnest.
moves.22. Ka3 Qd6+: 22. ........ Qd6+ - white now waves the white flag as I am closing in on the WK.  After the first two matches I see some light at the end of a very dark tunnel!

gameName: The Annotation Project - A Tentative Mating Attack
